item.description:
'The Outer Worlds' Is The 'Fallout' Game We've All Been Waiting For  Forbes

The Outer Worlds looks great. I imagine the developers at Obsidian have been watching the Fallout 76 with grim wonder and more than a little schadenfreude. After all, this is a studio who missed out on a bonus from publisher Bethesda because their game, Fallout: New Vegas, didn’t top 85 on Metacritic. Fallout 76 hasn’t even come close to that number. While New Vegas had its problems—Obsidian, like Bethesda, isn’t known for bug-free projects—it was an instant classic and a much-beloved entry into the franchise. Fallout 76 is a disaster. item.description:
Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire review – swashbuckling retro fun  The Guardian

Pillars of Eternity is an ambitious and successful gamble on role-playing game nostalgia, aimed squarely at people who enjoyed Baldur’s Gate and Planescape: Torment. The first game, released in 2015, brought in $4m in funding on Kickstarter. Its sequel, Deadfire, also raised over $4m in crowdfunding, and has just been released. Unlike its predecessor, Deadfire is arriving into a market with many similar games attempting to leverage 90s RPG nostalgia while adding their own twists to the genre.
